question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [IAT Backdating] Can an attacker backdate the 'iat' claim to a very early timestamp, effectively extending the ephemeral key validity indefinitely within max_exp_horizon_secs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Clock Skew Attack] Does the expiration comparison at line 76 account for clock skew between validators, or can timestamp differences cause consensus failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OidcClaims] [IAT vs EXP Validation] Are the iat and exp claims at lines 177-178 validated for logical consistency (iat < exp), or can reversed values bypass expiration checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Audience Confusion] When idc_aud_val override is used at lines 88-101, can an attacker exploit mismatches between JWT aud and IDC aud to access accounts intended for different audiences? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Allowlist Bypass] Can the is_allowed_override_aud check at lines 92-98 be bypassed through Unicode normalization, case manipulation, or URL encoding differences? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Issuer Validation] Does the iss comparison at line 81 use constant-time comparison to prevent timing attacks that could leak information about valid issuers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OidcClaims] [Multiple Audience] Can the aud field at line 174 be an array instead of string in actual JWT, causing deserialization to fail or only check first audience? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Null Byte Injection] Can issuer or audience strings contain null bytes that cause early string termination in comparisons, bypassing validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Panic on Deserialization] Can malformed jwt_payload_json cause serde_json to panic at line 62 instead of returning error, leading to validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Error Message Leakage] Do error messages at lines 70, 77, 83, 96, 106, 118 leak sensitive information about account structure or valid values? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: reconstruct_oauth_nonce()] [Propagation Failure] Can errors from pad_and_pack_bytes_to_scalars_with_len or pack_bytes_to_one_scalar be silently ignored, causing incorrect nonce acceptance? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: get_uid_val()] [Nested Error Handling] Can the context() error wrapping at lines 200, 211, 218, 220 hide critical validation failures that should abort transaction execution? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_signature()] [Silent Failure] Does verify_signature_without_exp_check properly propagate all RSA verification errors, or can some failures be silently ignored? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OpenIdSig] [Serde Bytes Annotation] Can the serde_bytes annotations at lines 24 and 31 be exploited to bypass length checks or cause incorrect byte vector handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: Claims] [Flatten Deserialization] Can the #[serde(flatten)] at lines 185 and 188 cause claim collisions where additional_claims override oidc_claims? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: OidcClaims] [Skip Serializing None] Does the skip_serializing_none at line 170 create asymmetry between serialization and deserialization that could be exploited? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_signature()] [Base64 Padding] Can base64url encoding functions handle padding correctly, or can attackers exploit RFC 4648 ambiguities in base64url encoding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Struct: Claims] [BTreeMap Ordering] Can the BTreeMap at line 189 introduce determinism issues if claim ordering affects signature or hash computation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Cross-Transaction Replay] Can a valid OpenIdSig be replayed across multiple transactions before exp_timestamp_secs, enabling unauthorized operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_claims()] [Nonce Reuse] Does the system track used nonces to prevent reuse, or can the same JWT be used multiple times within its validity period? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: verify_jwt_signature()] [Signature Replay Across Accounts] Can a JWT signature valid for one account be replayed to authenticate as a different account with the same OIDC identity? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Function: reconstruct_oauth_nonce()] [Ephemeral Key Reuse] Can the same ephemeral public key be used with different blinders to generate multiple valid nonces, enabling key reuse attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Import: poseidon_bn254] [Dependency Vulnerability] Can vulnerabilities in the poseidon_bn254 crate be exploited through hash_scalars or pack_bytes_to_one_scalar function calls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Import: RSA_JWK] [Key Material] Can the RSA_JWK type be manipulated to use weak key sizes, invalid exponents, or malicious moduli bypassing signature verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/openid_sig.rs] [Import: Configuration] [Config Tampering] Can on-chain Configuration parameters (max_exp_horizon_secs, max_commited_epk_bytes) be manipulated through governance to weaken security? (High)
